comment: such an easy course; non proctored quizzes and discussion posts are all you have to do.

He is someone I would take again, he goes into detail about the work. He also only has 3 tests throughout his class. Pretty easy test things that we learned in high school. He does speak for a long time and could get boring, but he's just passionate

I had POLS 1101 with Professor Peiper as a Maymester and I recommend the experience. Grade is fully based on 3 tests through D2L. Attendance was mandatory for the Maymester, I don't know what his policy is for a full term course. He's a charismatic lecturer and it's easy to pay attention during his lessons.

Professor Peiper's powerpoints were very vague but then he would talk on them for multiple minutes leaving you wondering if you needed to be writing down what he was saying. 3 tests make up the whole grade. The tests were mostly made up of information not found in his powerpoints. To be honest, it's the first B I've gotten since middle school.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This was an online class due to COVID. Peiper gives an outline of the notes via his lecture but YOU MUST read the textbook. If you do not read you will not pass! If you stay on top of your work, it's not a difficult or tedious class. 3 tests are the ONLY grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This class is very easy. Just show up and take notes because he takes attendance every class. Only allowed two absent days after that he takes points off final grade. There's 3 test in this class but they're all online. No classwork and no homework. BUT his lectures are very long and boring and he can talk about one slide for forever.

Dr. Pepper is an amazing professor. He is super passionate about politics and it overflows into his teaching. In this class, there were three tests, and those were the only grades, but attendance is mandatory. You are allowed to miss 2 classes without penalty and after that, your grade drops by one point for each absence. The class is interesting.

Assignment are short and to the point. Print the handouts, listen to his lecture and write notes. Biweekly quizzes are straight from the notes. No need to read the book. Biweekly discussion boards are a breeze. One paper. Great, easy class to take with this professor.

Favorite class and favorite professor that I've taken so far. Longform essay in the middle of the semester was a bit difficult, but other than that this class was as fun as a class can be. Definitely recommend Dr. Pieper for 1101

My favorite class and professor so far. One long paper in the middle of the semester which I did not enjoy, but the rest of the semester was as fun as a class can be. Definitely recommend taking Dr. Pieper for 1101

I took his class for a mini may mester, and he seriously was amazing! I had a bad taste in my mouth from professors at KSU; however, he reminded me why I love school! He was so real, and made sure that everyone understood the class! Take Him!!!!!!!!!

Great professor, really interested in what he's teaching. MUST attend his classes and he actually addes two points to your overall grade if you don't miss any classes. His grades consist of 3 online test and an easy paper. Would definitely take him if you can handle going to every class.

3 tests and a paper. Difficult tests and tough grader on the paper. GO to class and take notes! He does not post any notes on vista so again go to class! If you want an easy class pick another professor.
Great teacher.  Likes his subject and makes it interesting.  As long as you pay attention in class and do some review on your own, you will do well.
Lectures with power-points, 3 tests, 1 final (not cumulative), 1 paper. Interactive with class, sense of humor. Likes you to read the NYTimes. Good guy-
